text:
Hi everyone! Nice to meet you. I write and manage editorial/long-form at *Ellevest*, an online investment advisor built by women, for women. It's pretty much my dream job, but I'm always down for some great networking and professional development!

On an entirely unrelated note, I'm also a book reviewer and bookstagrammer — come find me on Instagram at @deedireads if you want to talk books. :books: :slightly_smiling_face:

text: Hello everyone! I'm Mariana from Chicago. So happy to have found this slack channel! What a great resource. I'm a freelancer who has been doing content, social media, and graphic design for small businesses, but like many others, find myself needing to pursue other opportunities. You can view all of my most recent work on my <https://mpadilla-digitalmarketing.weebly.com/|website>. I blog weekly and feature organizations with killer content marketing strategies, so I know good content when I see it! DM me if you want a copy of my resume! Cheers.

attachments.title: My Site
attachments.text: I create the engaging, original content and graphic design that your business needs to thrive.  ​ Creating maximum impact, together.

text: Hi everyone! Mark Armstrong here, I'm the founder of Longreads and an editor at Automattic. :wave: AMA. (And thanks <@UM2A21SJW> for the invite.) I know a ton of great editors, writers, audience development experts, and art directors and illustrators who are looking for freelance and full-time opportunities, so I'm happy to make introductions. <https://markarms.com/>

text:
Welcome aboard <@U01095M51U4>. This is a great coincidence, I just finished reading this story: <https://longreads.com/2020/03/18/girlhood-in-iran/|https://longreads.com/2020/03/18/girlhood-in-iran/>

It popped on my Twitter feed.

attachments.title: All that Was Innocent and Violent: Girlhood in Post-Revolution Iran
attachments.text: Naz Riahi recalls her vibrant childhood in a suburb of Tehran, and considers how the harsh realities imposed by the still new Islamic Republic seeped into her family's life.
attachments.fallback: Longreads Link: All that Was Innocent and Violent: Girlhood in Post-Revolution Iran

text:
Greetings from North Carolina!
I’m Jane, a content marketing manager at <https://adzerk.com/|Adzerk>, a Durham-based ad tech company where I focus on creating content and community for <https://adzerk.com/blog/|Ad.Product> (currently from home in Chapel Hill). Excited to get to know and learn from everyone here!

text:
Hi everyone, I'm Charles - I'm a lead content strategist at eBay on their payments team (start tomorrow - which is great timing, albeit less than ideal circumstances) based out of Silicon Valley, and currently under a lockdown order for three weeks (starting today). I also do some content marketing consulting - specialty is software/hardware.

I have 10+ years of experience and a few of my clients include: Airbnb, Intuit, IBM, Iron Mountain, Angie's List, Kaspersky Lab, and SRI International (an R&D institute that invented the Internet, Siri, and AI-based cancer treatments to augment chemo, among many other things).

My website is at <http://CharlesCosta.net|CharlesCosta.net> - you can reach me via the links there, or just DM here.

Always interested in connecting with people and chatting about marketing and things like that.

text: Hey <@UV6U807J7>! I work at Sprout Social and we loved (and appreciated!) your recent article. If you’re looking for freelance writing opps right now and you have experience with social media marketing, DM me a couple writing samples and I’ll see if our SEO team has an opening! I didn’t see content examples on your site, just design.
